alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 5:06AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 800 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rainfall intensifying over windward Big island from North Kohala District to Puna District. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some rivers in the area have already seen increased flows with additonal rises expected this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Kapaau, Honokaa, Pohakuloa Camp, Honomu, Papaikou, Laupahoehoe, Pepeekeo, Ninole, Hakalau, Ookala, Mountain View, Glenwood, Volcano, Paauilo, Pohakuloa Training Area, Keaau and Hawaiian Acres. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 800 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect for Maui County and the Big Island until 600 AM HST Sunday.
